abcc exchange club.content:
ABCC Exchange Club

(Part 2)
Always wanted to learn more about cryptocurrency but don't know where to start?

Come join us on 15th March (Tue), 8pm (UTC +8) as we share the basics of cryptocurrency in a short 30mins.

Speakers:

Alan Li - CEO of ABCC Exchange
Marcus Yeo - Business Development Manager of ABCC Exchange

We will also be taking questions after the session so do stay till the end!

Introduction to Cryptocurrency by ABCC Exchange

ac sin.content:
Analytics.Club Singapore

AnalyticsCLUB JobExpo is created to promote virtual, happy, and healthy hiring within the Data Analytics Community. The signature program from Analytics.CLUB would attract 150,000 global participants(About 6k recruiters and 150k global seekers).
To learn more, read JobExpo FAQ at https://tao.ai/jobexp....

The Process:
Create an account on https://analytics.clu...
Visit https://analytics.clu... and register your interest
5-7 days before the event, JobExpo will communicate with everyone to complete the signup process(register as a job seeker, recruiter or partner, if not already completed)
3-5 days before the event, JobExpo will communicate with everyone about the process
1-3 days before the event, JobExpo will communicate with everyone about approving the potential matches
On suggested timeslots(transmitted via JobExpo communication) all the subscriber will come to JobExpo site and interact withing the right groups/chat sessions to take job conversation forward
After JobExpo, all subscribers are encouraged to provide feedback so that TAO.ai could enhance the personal experience for all the subscribers.
* Please note JobExpo always value your time and ensures you never have to wait unless JobExpo has identified a match for you.

Why it Matters?
Best industry hirings are done with the power of networking and reference. JobExpo uses the power of skill connectivity and an identical profile portfolio to connect similar candidates to relevant opportunities. JobExpo brings relationships and connection back into hiring.

Takeaways?
We expect the event to:
1. Create interesting conversations
2. Improve access to local talent and local opportunities
3. Provide a venue to promote effective hiring
4. Connect professionals with other seekers so they could collaborate and improve their search
5. Discover what some of the top businesses are looking for in a talent
6. Educate recruiters and job seekers about top trends and hiring skills that are trendy and rising.

About JobExpo
JobExpo is World's largest open community talent platform that is built on the TAO.ai Talent Analytics Artificial Intelligence platform to bring virtual career events to various communities around the World. JobExpo event currently powers more than 2 million communities around the globe.

About TAO.ai
TAO.ai is created out of a need from AnalyticsWeek. In the age when Artificial Intelligence is synonymized with losing jobs, AnalyticsWeek's vast community started demanding an Artificial Intelligence that could help people find employment, live better professional life and enjoy a healthy, happy, and growth centered life. TAO.ai currently powers several large internet communities and assisting people in living healthy and happy.

Singapore, - Singapore

Friday, April 1 at 11:00 AM

2

3-5 days before the event, JobExpo will communicate with everyone about the process
1-3 days before the event, JobExpo will communicate with everyone about approving the potential matches
On suggested timeslots(transmitted via JobExpo communication) all the subscriber will come to JobExpo site and interact withing the right groups/chat sessions to take job conversation forward
After JobExpo, all subscribers are encouraged to provide feedback so that TAO.ai could enhance the personal experience for all the subscribers.
* Please note JobExpo always value your time and ensures you never have to wait unless JobExpo has identified a match for you.
 Why it Matters?
Best industry hirings are done with the power of networking and reference. JobExpo uses the power of skill connectivity and an identical profile portfolio to connect similar candidates to relevant opportunities. JobExpo brings relationships and connection back into hiring.
 Takeaways?
We expect the event to:
1. Create interesting conversations
2. Improve access to local talent and local opportunities
3. Provide a venue to promote effective hiring
4. Connect professionals with other seekers so they could collaborate and improve their search
5. Discover what some of the top businesses are looking for in a talent
6. Educate recruiters and job seekers about top trends and hiring skills that are trendy and rising.
 About JobExpo
JobExpo is World's largest open community talent platform that is built on the TAO.ai Talent Analytics Artificial Intelligence platform to bring virtual career events to various communities around the World. JobExpo event currently powers more than 2 million communities around the globe.
 About TAO.ai
TAO.ai is created out of a need from AnalyticsWeek. In the age when Artificial Intelligence is synonymized with losing jobs, AnalyticsWeek's vast community started demanding an Artificial Intelligence that could help people find employment, live better professional life and enjoy a healthy, happy, and growth centered life. TAO.ai currently powers several large internet communities and assisting people in living healthy and happy.
  
Singapore - Singapore
 Friday, September 2 at 11:00 AM
 1
 https://www.meetup.com/ac-sin/events/prxnwrydcmbdb/
ac sin.title: AnalyticsCLUB JobExpo Virtual Business, Data & Technology Job Expo

Agile Singapore.content:
Agile Singapore

The ability to be Agile is also the ability to get into an: action, feedback, outcome, action loop. It is an opportunity for a team to organise themselves to work to their strengths and to manage conflict at source in an anti-fragile way. 

A foundation to this way of working is to know yourself and to have a short-hand way of understanding others. We use metaphors - they are interesting, they are sticky and much easier to remember than many other profiling tools AND most importantly, they are self-generated so they can be updated as we grow and change and understand ourselves better.

Caitlin Walker, author of Contempt to Curiosity; creating the conditions for groups to collaborate, has spent over 20 years finding simple sustainable practises that help individuals move from drama to outcome and action.

In this workshop, Caitlin will introduce you to three of your own metaphors: When you're at your best, when you're at your worst and how you make decisions. From these three metaphors you can start to make predictions for what you need to be at your best and how others might clash with you.

For an introduction to Clean Questions and Metaphor Models, watch Caitlin's TedX talk here: (https://youtu.be/aVvc..." class="embedded">https://youtu.be/aVvc...)

If you are interested in uncovering some models used in the Hidden Skills of Agile - Clean Language, please approach the host (Victor Loke) for a free resource. This can be used as a visual aid for using Clean Language to elicit metaphors as resources.

**Caitlin Walker**
Caitlin has been designing, experimenting, testing, updating and redesigning interventions that support groups to become self-organising. She began with teenagers outside of the school system, moved into IT companies and now delivers projects and trains her approach around the world. She is author of 'From Contempt to Curiosity - creating the conditions for groups to collaborate' and 'So you want to be DramaFree' and has recently completed her PhD in Clean Language Interviewing as a research methodology. Born in Jos, Nigeria, she currently lives near Liverpool and can be found doing executive, team  and organisational coaching in person and online.

Singapore, - Singapore

Thursday, March 31 at 7:00 PM

all things startups tech investing vc fu.content:
The Startup Tank Singapore Top Founders Pitch for VC Funding

Are you a startup looking for funding?
Are you an investor looking for interesting companies to invest in?

Either way, you've come to the right place.

Welcome to **(https://mattward.io/r...)** presented by **(https://mattward.io/s...)**, the startup pitch fest where founders get a chance to pitch their project to prospective investors, possible cofounders and the tech ecosystem as a whole.

If you've ever wanted a chance to pitch your company or get in front of VCs and angel investors, now is your time to shine.

**YOU MUST APPLY HERE to attend** \- that includes both startups and investors:

**(https://thestartuptan..." class="linkified">https://thestartuptan...)**

## **SELECT PRESENTING STARTUPS INCLUDE:**

HipHipHub - The go to marketplace for parents planning birthday parties.
Musing.io - Decentralized Reddit with rewards for insights & engagement.
BearCover - Robot-assisted nursing home care.
Dewzi - Sustainable, reusable on-the-go wipes.
Signex - The Bloomberg of sentiment/community analysis for NFT traders.
Xander - AR that actually makes sense: caption assist for hearing impaired.
LegendsX - Because NFT-based gaming should be awesome too.

**(https://mattward.io/sy...)**

The Syndicate angel group invests in mission-driven pre seed to Series A startups tackling big problems in the areas of commerce/ecommerce, platforms/marketplaces, consumer tech, fintech, cleantech & climate change, B2B/enterprise, hardware-as-a-service and of course software/SaaS.

For more information on The Syndicate and to apply to join, please visit: **(https://mattward.io/s...)**

--

**BONUS:** Interested in fundraising for your startup? Be sure to check out my 5-part series: The Ultimate Guide to Startup Fundraising:

**(https://mattward.io/s..." class="linkified">https://mattward.io/s...)**

--

**(https://mattward.io/r...)**

YCombinator popularized the demo day. Shark Tank revolutionized the investor pitch. We take the best of both worlds combined with the Covid-fueled remote nature of everything to bring you **(mattward.io/remote)** presented by **(mattward.io/syndicate)**, the startup pitch fest where founders get to pitch to prospective investors, possible cofounders and the tech ecosystem as a whole.

If you’ve ever wanted a chance to pitch your company or get in front of VCs and angel investors, now is your time to shine.

**About the host:**

I am a serial entrepreneur, startup advisor and business coach, occasional angel investor and ex-VC podcast host interested in helping startup founders change the world for the better.

And to do that, founders need funding and support. That's why I help mission-driven companies with the strategy, growth and fundraising to change the world faster.

To learn more about what me, how I help 10x results, and what past clients have to say about working together, visit **(https://mattward.io/te...)**

Tuesday, March 15 at 1:00 AM

asean scaled agile framework meetup grou.content:
ASEAN Scaled Agile Framework Meetup Group

Join other agile professionals for our first official ASEAN SAFe Meetup on Tuesday 15th March. Our guest speaker, Hiroki Nakaya-san, will be presenting on the topic of "Accelerating Digital Transformation (DX)."

This Meetup will become a monthly event, and attendees can vote on the topics and speakers that they wish to see. Whether you are interested in SAFe Business Agility, Digital Transformation, DevOps, Scrum, Lean Portfolio Management or another aspect of SAFe, you will be able to gather insights and hear stories from other businesses in the region.

**Guest Speaker - Hiroaki Nakaya san -** Strategic Advisor
*Topic: "Accelerating Digital Transformation (DX)"*

In his previous job, as a change agent for a global company, Nakaya-San collaborated with Japan, the United States, and Asian countries to enable change on a worldwide scale. He has extensive experience in coaching, consulting, management and SAFe training for Lean-Agile transformation and has led a series of SAFe implementation processes. He obtained the highest SAFe trainer qualification for the very first time in Japan.

As a strategic advisor at Scaled Agile, Inc., he specialises in consulting on SAFe introduction for customers and partner companies and training for SAFe trainers. He is striving to build an understanding of the benefits of the Scaled Agile Framework in APAC.

Singapore, - Singapore

Tuesday, March 15 at 7:00 PM

189

https://www.meetup.com/asean-scaled-agile-framework-meetup-group/events/284217940/

Automation Anywhere RPA Singapore.content:
Automation Anywhere RPA Singapore

Automation 360 platform is getting more powerful with every new release and there are a host of new features getting added every time we come out with a new version.

You may have learnt and tried out a couple of new features, but there may still be features that you may have not yet explored or have questions about.

In this session, we will cover a few exciting features from the last few releases and answer any questions you may have. We wouldn’t want to share the list of specific features we will cover, just to keep the suspense on, however here are the release notes from the last 2 releases for your reference.
(https://docs.automati...)
(https://docs.automati...)

To join us, please (https://automationany...).

We are inviting RPA experts to come forward and share their expertise with the Developer community through these virtual meetups.

If you would like to deliver a session on the Automation 360 platform or if you have an idea for a blog post/tutorial that you think would benefit the Automation Anywhere developer community, let us know at (https://mailto:develop...).

AzureSG.content:
Azure Community Singapore (ACS)

👉Implementing Hybrid Network Connections with Azure

The IPsec and IKE protocol widespread support many cryptographic algorithms in diverse combinations. When installing a VPN connection in Azure, we should configure the connection at both ends. If we're configuring a VPN connection among Azure and a hardware device along with a transfer or router, this acts as a VPN gateway; that tool may ask you for added settings.

🗣 Viknaraj Manogararajah \(Microsoft MVP \(Azure\) \| Microsoft MCT Regional Lead \| C\# Corner MVP\)

Singapore, - Singapore

Thursday, March 31 at 7:00 PM

11

https://www.meetup.com/AzureSG/events/284443300/

Blockchain Educators SG.content:
Blockchain Educators | SG

**ONLINE SELF-PACED COURSE**

A six hour intensive course, A to Z on blockchain, we cover every subject. Perfect for beginners, entrepreneurs, business leaders and blockchain enthusiast.

**ONLY $97.99**

REGISTER HERE: https://rb.gy/ht6n0w...

Course Syllabus:

Introduction
What is Blockchain
Blockchain Glossary
We provide 64 technical terms and definitions that relate to blockchain technology.
Why is Blockchain a revolutionary Technology
Blockchain Applications by Industry
Blockchain Transaction Model
Bitcoin & Blockchain: how are they connected
What is a Cryptocurrency
Bitcoin: A Peer to Peer Electronic Cash System
Benefits of using Blockchain Technology
Consensus
Consensus Protocol
Safety
Liveness
Fault Tolerance
Blockchain Fork
Consensus Failure
Dominance
Cheating
Poor Performance
Choosing the right blockchain
What is Cryptography
Cryptographic encryption
Elliptic-curve Cryptography (ECC)
What is Blockchain Mining (Bitcoin Examples)
The Computationally-Difficult Program
The Difficulty Metric
Block Reward
Hardware
Blockchain Business Use Cases
Private vs. Public Blockchain
Permissionless vs. Permissioned
What is Ethereum
Proof of Work
Solidity
Homestead
EthHash
Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)
Serenity (POS)
What is Microsoft Azure Workbench Blockchain
What is Hyperledger
Hyperledger Fabric
The Practical Byzantine Fault Tolerance (PBFT)
SIEVE
Cross-Fault Tolerance (XFT)
Hyperledger SawtoothLake
Proof of Elapsed Time
Hyperledger Iroha
Hyperledger Burrow
What is Ripple & Stellar Blockchain
Ripple Consensus Protocol Algorithm
Stellar Consensus Protocol Algorithm
What is a Smart contract
What is Proof of Stake
What is the EOS blockchain
Proof of Stake
EOS Vs. Ethereum
Denial of Service Attacks
Consensus Mechanism & Governance
What is Bitshares Blockchain & DEX
Delegated Proof of Stake (DPOS)
Transaction Confirmation
Proof of Stake Consensus
Block Production by Elected Witnesses
Parameter Change by Elected Delegates
Changing the Rules (aka Hard Forks)
Double Spend Attack
Transactions as Proof of Stake
Blockchain Reorganizations
Maximally Decentralized
NEM Blockchain Review
AI / Quantum computing and Blockchain

We will provide an online exam to provide your final grade and certificate of completion.

About Us: www.BlockchainEducators.org

Conversational AI Singapore.content:
Conversational AI Singapore

The pandemic disrupted and changed the way consumers interact with organisations, expecting and demanding accessibility 24/7 through the use of digital channels. From medical support, rescheduling holidays to obtaining emergency loans, call centers were at the center of it all. In a time that heavily influenced consumer loyalty, slow responses, high attrition rates, call volumes and delays, organisations faced a huge loss in brand confidence.

At the same time, how can we provide 24/7 accessibility without the need of investing in more staff, whilst improving customer and employee satisfaction? How can complex requests be handled and managed without expanding?

With the advances in Process Automation and Machine Learning, we believe the answer lies in Conversational AI to provide human-like experiences with meaningful, outcomes based experiences. Join this webinar to learn how conversational AI will change the way contact centers operate and how companies are benefiting from it today.

About CGI
Founded in 1976, CGI is among the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world. We are insights-driven and outcomes-based to help accelerate returns on your investments. We are delighted to be partnering with them to implement the platform for clients.

About Artificial Solutions
Designed for the global enterprise, Artificial Solutions’ advanced conversational AI platform Teneo allows business users and developers to collaborate on creating sophisticated, highly intelligent applications that run across over 86 languages, multiple OS and channels in record time.

Singapore, - Singapore

Monday, March 14 at 3:00 PM

3

https://www.meetup.com/Conversational-AI-Singapore/events/284462566/

data ai meetup sg.content:
Data, Cloud and AI in Singapore

Please join the IBM Data Science Community for our March 2022 virtual meetup.

**⏰ Agenda**

* 10.45am – Doors open
* 11.00am – Welcome
* 11.02am – IBM Community announcements
* 11.08am – Lightning talk: Exploring the Manning liveProject tutorial for IBM Project Debater API (Paco Nathan)
* 11:15am – Main talk: Trustworthy Machine Learning (Kush R. Varshney) plus Q&A
* 11:55am – Mingle
* 12:00pm – Official event ends (IBM community team and speakers may stick around a little bit longer if there are still more questions)

**💬 Lighting talk (5') – Exploring the Manning liveProject tutorial for IBM Project Debater API**

Suppose you're on a data science team that handles lots of text: customer responses, news analysis, medical transcriptions, bill of materials, patent applications, or other similar cases. How do you manage data quality within the stream of input data? How do you determine which elements of the surrounding text support the arguments that get extracted by ML models? How do you expand the phrases your customers use to link into more commonly-used phrases?

While there have been incredible advances in the use of language models for predicting sequences of text, other areas of NLP have also been advancing. This “liveProject” tutorial at Manning provides goal-oriented, hands-on coding examples of how to leverage the IBM Project Debater API to analyze a Kaggle dataset about medical transcriptions. Milestones in this tutorial include data preparation techniques in Pandas, use of the *Key Point Analysis*, *Argument Quality*, and *Term Wikifier* API services, data visualization in Seaborn, and building an interactive dashboard of the results in Streamlit.

**👨🏻‍💻 Speaker bio**

(https://derwen.ai/pac...) is Managing Partner at Derwen, Inc. Known as a “player/coach”, with core expertise in data science, cloud computing, natural language, graph technologies; \~40 years tech industry experience, ranging from Bell Labs to early-stage start-ups. Advisor for Amplify Partners, Recognai, KUNGFU.AI. Lead committer PyTextRank, kglab. Formerly: Director, Community Evangelism @ Databricks and Apache Spark.

**💬 Main talk (40') – Trustworthy Machine Learning**

Accuracy is not enough when you’re developing machine learning systems for consequential application domains. You also need to make sure that your models are fair, have not been tampered with, will not fall apart in different conditions, and can be understood by people. Your design and development process has to be transparent and inclusive. You don’t want the systems you create to be harmful, but to help people flourish in ways they consent to. All of these considerations beyond accuracy that make machine learning safe, responsible, and worthy of our trust have been described by many experts as the biggest challenge of the next five years. This talk aims to equip you with the thought process to meet this challenge.

**👨🏻‍💻 Speaker bio**

Kush R. Varshney is a distinguished research staff member and manager with IBM Research at the Thomas J. Watson Research Center, Yorktown Heights, NY, where he leads the machine learning group in the Foundations of Trustworthy AI department. He was a visiting scientist at IBM Research - Africa, Nairobi, Kenya in 2019. He is the founding co-director of the IBM Science for Social Good initiative. He applies data science and predictive analytics to human capital management, healthcare, olfaction, computational creativity, public affairs, international development, and algorithmic fairness and conducts academic research on the theory and methods of trustworthy machine learning. He self-published a book entitled 'Trustworthy Machine Learning' ((https://www.trustworth..." class="linkified">https://www.trustworth...)) in 2022.

**🦄 Join your local IBM Community meetup team**

Want to get involved in your local IBM Community meetup? Join our Slack: (https://join.slack.co..." class="linkified">https://join.slack.co...)

Singapore, - Singapore

Thursday, March 17 at 2:00 AM

7

https://www.meetup.com/data-ai-meetup-sg/events/284364803/

data engineering sg.content:
Data Engineering Singapore

Halo Data Engineers Singapore!
Welcome to our Mar edition.

Topic - Solving the hurdles of embedding the analytical dashboards into transactional web application, by Abubakkar Siddiq Mohamed Farook @ DBS.

"OLTP and OLAP are two different worlds. It is challenging when we want to make a bridge between these two and feed OLTP data into OLAP dashboard on real-time. We will discuss about how did we achieve the same in one of my assignment. "

Abubakkar Siddiq Mohamed Farook is a seasoned full stack architect and technology leader with 15 years of experience in IT with different roles such as solution architect.

07:00 pm: Event start & welcome address

08:10 pm - 08:15 pm: Event end

Hope to see all of you online. It will be broadcast via the YouTube link below and questions can be posted on the YouTube chat boxes which we will answer them during the session.

Cheers!
DESG

Data Vis Singapore.content:
Data Vis Singapore

Hi,
A big thank you to Ivan for agreeing to give this talk as an alumni and also to the wider community at large!

Synopsis:
Why use network visualisation? What insights can we gleam from constructing our data into graphs? Running through several open data examples, this talk will be a primer towards experimenting with network visualisations yourself!

Speaker:
Ivan Chuang is a data scientist at Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX). He is also an alumni of the MSc in Urban Science, Planning and Policy (MUSPP) at SUTD. He has interests in social data science, and enjoys experimenting with networks on open data. Ivan runs a site at https://vnck.xyz/...

Cheers,
Chi-Loong,
Data Viz SG / HHSG organizer / HASS IDV adjunct lecturer
\*Run in tandem with the HHSG meetup group and SUTD's HASS Interactive Data Visualization course.

Ivan Chuang is a data scientist at Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX). He is also an alumni of the MSc in Urban Science, Planning and Policy (MUSPP) at SUTD. He has interests in social data science, and enjoys experimenting with networks on open data. Ivan runs a site at https://vnck.xyz/...
 Cheers,
Chi-Loong,
Data Viz SG / HHSG organizer / HASS IDV adjunct lecturer
\*Run in tandem with the HHSG meetup group and SUTD's HASS Interactive Data Visualization course.

founders network singapore.content:
Founders Network Singapore

According to a recent report, 53 percent of businesses expect their IT budgets to grow over the next 12 months. The report indicates the top factor driving companies to increase budgets is an elevated priority on IT projects.

IT can make or break a startup. Whether it’s having dependable cloud infrastructure or a reliable IT support team to field customer issues, how well a startup executes their IT operation is a key indicator of success. While tech startups might seem uniquely positioned to handle IT implementation and management, IT functions can be a burden on funding and resources.

That’s why many companies are turning to managed services. According to the report, in 2022, companies plan to spend significantly more of their tech budgets on managed services, which involve outsourcing IT functions to a third-party. Small-and-medium-sized businesses plan to spend 14 percent of their IT budgets on managed services.

IT outsourcing is an increasingly popular business strategy. According to tech entrepreneur (https://www.linkedin....) it can help startups cut costs and shift focus to core business activities.

Subhash is the CEO of (https://www.linkedin....), an IT solutions provider. On April 5, 2022, he will be hosting a webinar for Founders Network members where he’ll discuss the importance of outsourcing key customer experience functions and cybersecurity operations.

You’ll also learn:

* Benefits of outsourcing support services
* Benefits of outsourcing software development services
* Benefits of outsourcing managed security operations
* Benefits of having a security operations center

**About the Speaker:**

(https://members.found...) is a proven technology entrepreneur and executive with a track record of successful ventures. Prior to becoming CEO of NextServ, he was the co-founder and CEO of OneCloud Consulting, which was acquired by ePlus Technologies in 2017, where he was Vice President of Innovation and Emerging Technology. He gained extensive experience building products and businesses from the ground up. He is proficient at leading cross-functional, transformational initiatives across diverse groups to successfully develop Go To Market Strategy (GTM) and launch innovative services, and solutions.

Subhash is a seasoned executive with strong management experience in product development, corporate development, technology and services strategy, business operations and Product marketing with a proven track record of building strategic plans, building high performing organizations and enhancing operational efficiency. His vast experience also includes working at various roles in IBM, Cisco and Salesforce on Datacenter and Cloud Technologies. He holds a bachelor’s in computer science.

**About NetServ:**

(https://www.netserv.i...) empowers businesses to get ahead and stay ahead of change by delivering mission-critical IT services. We are driven to lead organizations to modernize IT Operations, Data Center, Cloud and security environments. Our 90+ strong team of senior technology experts, cloud and data center architects, security architects, software developers, and technical trainers bring years of extensive experience to every customer engagement.

If you’re looking for a trusted partner in the complex world of enterprise IT environment, Netserv will act as a trusted advisor and become your team of trained and certified professionals to support you with our team of experienced specialists and help to eliminate your IT problems. We promise better ROI and help enterprises to shorten the learning curve and allow core professionals to focus on core business strategies. All our solutions are designed based on the well-architected framework and best practices.

\*\*\* You must register on Eventbrite to attend this event. RSVPing on Meetup alone does not equal event registration. Limited space available. Register at https://www.eventbrit... \*\*\*

founders network singapore.content:
Founders Network Singapore

**Dropbox’s secure document sharing and analytics company DocSend regularly tracks startup investment trends via analysis of pitch decks sent through the platform. According to their analysis from 2021, venture capitalist engagement with startup pitch decks reached an all-time high in Q4 and increased 44 percent across the full year.**

This analysis underlines the vital role pitch decks play in fundraising. While in-person meetings remain popular, pitch decks today serve as both a calling card for startup founders and an efficient way for VCs to quickly sift through potential opportunities.

That’s why serial entrepreneur (https://members.found...) is passionate about giving entrepreneurs the tools necessary to create an effective pitch deck. As a partner and COO at (https://www.forumvc.c...), he plays an active role in supporting Founders on their journey. Forum helps B2B SaaS companies go from startup to scale, with investment, an accelerator program focused on go-to-market strategy, and fundraising.

“Being able to support startup founders gives me a lot of satisfaction because I’ve been there,” Midanik says. “It’s a really lonely journey. You’re over-resourced. You’re underpaid. You’re overworked. It can be an incredibly isolating experience.”

On April 7, 2022, Midanik will be hosting a webinar for Founders Network members where he’ll provide a tutorial on how to craft a pitch deck that makes an impact on investors.

At his webinar, Midanik will also cover:

* The value of an effective pitch deck
* What VCs are looking for in your pitch deck
* How to craft an engaging narrative
* How to condense your message

**About the Speaker:**
(https://www.linkedin....) has spent the last two decades in the Canadian startup ecosystem. He has successfully founded and run both bootstrapped and venture backed companies. Now he spends his time as a partner at (https://www.linkedin....) supporting B2B SaaS founders with capital, as well as the sales, marketing, fundraising and product help that early stage founders need.
An engineer by trade, Serial Entreprenuer by choice, Jonah Midanik supports founders on their journey to building world class companies out of Canada - while occasionally still founding companies of his own.

\*\*\* You must register on Eventbrite to attend this event. RSVPing on Meetup alone does not equal event registration. Limited space available. Register at https://www.eventbrit... \*\*\*

founders network singapore.content:
Founders Network Singapore

**Since its founding in 2020, AI notetaker application Fathom has gained rapid traction. The startup announced it had raised a $4.7 million seed round earlier this year. Additionally, the application, which was developed exclusively for the Zoom Marketplace, secured 10,000 signups early on and is currently the #1 app on the platform.**

(https://fathom.video/...) Founder and CEO (https://members.found...) attributes Fathom’s early success to the startup’s go-to-market model. The company landed on a bottom up model early on and the model informed much of their strategy.
“We thought about go to market and distribution at about the same time we came up with the product itself,” White says. “Knowing your go to market model really drives a lot of product decisions, as well as marketing decisions and team composition decisions.”

On April 12, White will host a webinar for Founders Network members where he’ll discuss different go-to-market models in tech and how deciding on a go-to-market model early on can greatly benefit startups.

At his webinar, White will also cover

* The benefits and challenges of different GTM models
* The factors to consider when choosing a go-to-market model
* What research to conduct before deciding on a go-to-market strategy
* How GTM strategy is different from a product launch

**About the Speaker:**

**(https://www.linkedin....)** is founder and CEO of (https://www.linkedin....), a free app that records, transcribes & highlights your calls so you can focus on the conversation instead of taking notes.

Fathom was a part of the Y-Combinator W21 batch, is one of only 50 Zoom App Launch Partners, and is one of a small handful of companies Zoom has invested in directly via their Zoom Apps Fund.

Prior to Fathom, Richard founded UserVoice, one of the leading platforms that technology companies, from startups to the Fortune 500, use for managing customer feedback and making strategic product decisions. UserVoice was notable for being the company that originally invented the Feedback tabs shown on the side of millions of websites around the world today.

Richard previously worked on Kiko, a company in the first batch of Y-Combinator, with Justin Kan and Emmett Shear who subsequently went on to found Twitch. Richard is passionate about designing intuitive productivity tools with delightful user experiences.

\*\*\* You must register on Eventbrite to attend this event. RSVPing on Meetup alone does not equal event registration. Limited space available. Register at https://www.eventbrit... \*\*\*

Singapore, - Singapore

Wednesday, April 13 at 12:30 AM

2

Hi Kakis,
Let's meet for Makan Buffet Session at La Jiang Shan Hotpot BBQ Parklane Shopping Mall on 19th March 130pm to 3pm, we have 90 mins to enjoy our meal.
This is in collaboration with Scotty's International friends hangout, drink and talk meetup group.
All members of all nationalities are welcome to join us for this wonderful lunch. Let's gather as friends and have a great time together.
After lunch buffet we can go have more activities at nearby malls, anybody can suggest any activities.
Do RSVP and Join our Singapore Meetup WhatsApp Group at https://chat.whatsapp...
For Latest update about our events.

Saturday, March 19 at 1:30 PM

Kakis SG Anything Watever Meetup Group.content:
Kakis SG Anything Watever Meetup Group

Make New Friends.

- Drink & talk group started with a basic vision that everyone can reach to everyone easily.

-  Learn from each other, chat on topics that you like, relieve yourselves from stress of life, improve communication skills, and a  lots of smiles 😃 -

 the fun part is can meet different ppl from different world and background .

-4 important things

RSVP Acronym

1) Respect

2) Smile

3) happy

4) Participation

 -4 DON'T do things

1) NO Religion

2) NO Sexual Harassment

3) No Personal Attacks

4) No Politics

- Zoom is a great platform - we will use the room breakout session function so that ppl can chat in different smaller groups (3 to 6 ppl)

-Download Zoom for newbie.

Be sure to check your Personal Message (PM) on that day for the Zoom ID or Link.

- Also, we understand that life can be stressful, lets relive stresses quickly😄

- Do RSVP now 😃

See you, looking forward

Scotty and violet

Co-organizers

Drink & talk group

Singapore, - Singapore

Saturday, March 19 at 9:00 PM

Lean about Microsoft Flow from an inside.content:
Learn about Microsoft Power Platform from an insider

Join us for this FREE, FULL-DAY automation workshop as part of Microsoft's RPA in a Day series.

Please sign up for the training via this link with your business email address (NOT just RSVP in Meetup): https://msevents.micr...

RPA in a Day is a beginner-level training designed for everyone to learn RPA-based automation—no matter if you are a business expert or IT developer.

The training provides practical hands-on experience with professional developers who specialize in creating Power Automate solutions.

=========
WHAT WILL YOU LEARN?

The trainers—who are professional developers—will guide you through building a modern end-to-end RPA-based automation to process incoming invoices:

1. Initiating the invoicing process upon requestor's email
2. Extracting the invoice information from the email attachment
3. Triggering the approval process in Microsoft Teams
4. Generating an invoice record in the invoicing application
5. Converting the currency using an online converter and writing the invoice information into an Excel file
6. Sending email notifications to the requestor for both approval/rejection cases

***

At the end of the day, you will be able to:

* Use Power Automate capabilities such as UI flows and API connectors to automate a business process
* Take advantage of form processing models developed in AI Builder

=========
HOW DO YOU SIGN UP?

You'll need to sign up for the training here with you business email (NOT just RSVP in Meetup): https://msevents.micr...

Singapore, - Singapore

Thursday, March 24 at 9:00 AM

5

https://www.meetup.com/Lean-about-Microsoft-Flow-from-an-insider/events/284479208/

NET Developers SG.content:
.NET Developers Community Singapore

👉Implementing Hybrid Network Connections with Azure

The IPsec and IKE protocol widespread support many cryptographic algorithms in diverse combinations. When installing a VPN connection in Azure, we should configure the connection at both ends. If we're configuring a VPN connection among Azure and a hardware device along with a transfer or router, this acts as a VPN gateway; that tool may ask you for added settings.

🗣 Viknaraj Manogararajah
\(Microsoft MVP \(Azure\) \| Microsoft MCT Regional Lead \| C\# Corner MVP\)

Product School Singapore.content:
Product School Singapore

DISCLAIMER: Register (https://prdct.school/...) to watch the stream or access the replay

The art of influencing without authority involves understanding and empathizing with different sets of people. And to do that, you need to develop certain soft skills that will help lead your team and make your stakeholders understand any decision you’re taking. It's time to learn from top PM leaders!

Main Takeaways:

* Empathy and mediation are the key skills to establishing a great relationship.
* Algorithms are scary and introduce uncertainty for many business stakeholders. Make people feel safe and understood.
* Data-driven products are complex and usually a black box for business stakeholders. Help people to understand what is going on and translate technicalities.

Meet the Speaker: Tobias Henke

Tobias is a Senior Product Manager at Zalando. He is working together with product and engineering teams located across Europe to build the core ranking and query understanding capabilities of Zalando's on-site search.

(https://prdct.school/...)

Product School Singapore.content:
Product School Singapore

DISCLAIMER: Register (https://prdct.school/... watch the stream or access the replay

Almost anything can be subjected to A/B testing. Websites, emails, ads, and even app interfaces are frequently tested. Besides, there are tons of different variables that can be manipulated to generate variants for the test. But before you decide what to do an A/B test on, here are some things to take into account.

Main takeaways:

* There is no one right way of validating a product, A/B testing is just one of them
* Get your product 'qualitatively' validated before 'quantitatively' validating
* Use holdouts to measure the long term success of your new products, while running A/B test in parallel

Meet the Speaker: Namrata Panwar

Namrata always goes the extra mile to deliver great user experiences. Currently, Namrata is a Senior Product Manager at Booking.com.

What the heck is product sense? Sure there are frameworks, but to be truly excellent in this area of Product Management, this skill is best developed by getting better at identifying and understanding multiple levels of context. We will go over 3 quick case studies that will help you leverage your natural abilities to get better at product sense. As a bonus, you'll become more efficient at problem solving.

Takeaways:

* Understand External Context
* Understand Strategic Context
* Understand Team Context

Jordan Smallwood is someone who has shown drive, passion, and promise for product since early in his career. He is currently working in Tech Product Management at Amazon.

This session will cover the complexities of working with products across the physical and software arena. We'll be covering how ideas and concepts become reality, how a PM works cross-functionally with multiple teams to keep a project flowing, and how a PM continues to iterate and improve upon products after they've made it to consumers' hands.

Main Takeaways:

* How you can identify and validate problems to solve and scope a market opportunity
* How to pitch to your internal investors (your GMs & VPs)
* How to take your idea to market and validate product-market fit

Join us for an interactive fireside chat series with Product Leaders from top tech companies worldwide. This is an exclusive Q&A session hosted by Product School Founder & CEO, Carlos Gonzalez de Villaumbrosia, to give you a chance to ask every question you’ve ever had for Derek Andersen, CEO at Bevy. Derek Andersen will discuss what it’s like to work in this dynamic role and what it takes to get your foot in the door. You’ll also get the inside scoop on the day-to-day work as a CEO, the challenges of the job and personal insights from their experience.

In B2B and tech-heavy products, technology IS a central part of the product value. PMs could be required to show special balance and approach around their technology knowledge level while keeping their head always in the customer’s point of view.

Main takeaways:

* What level of technical knowledge should a PM have? Which different categories of tech knowledge?
* Why does a PM need technical knowledge?
* Do you need to have a development background to be a technical PM?
* The secret sauce for a great technical PM

Meet the Speaker: Ariel Lemelson

Ariel Lemelson is a Product Lead and a cybersecurity expert with 15 years of experience. Ariel is passionate about cybersecurity and using innovative technologies to solve problems thus delivering customer value. Currently, he is the Head of Cyber Detection & Response at Booking.com. He also acts as a Group Product Manager, where he creates a strategic roadmap and long-term vision.

**DISCLAIMER: Register (https://bit.ly/3BjnUO...) to watch the stream or access the replay**

As a Product Manager, you will be working day and night in developing the best and most impactful products. However, you must strive to avoid major pitfalls and construct the process that best suits you, but most importantly, your product.

Main Takeaway:
“The meaning of ‘Radical Candor’ is care personally, challenge directly, and when you do both at the same time, that’s good.” Wise words by Kim Scott, the author of Radical Candor. This webinar will show the direct application it has in Product Management where saying ‘no’ and building consensus in conflict happens often. After this session, you’ll know what Radical Candor is and how to operationalize it as a Product Manager.

Meet the Speaker: Irena Lam

Irena is a Product Leader at Facebook working on music within video and entertainment. Previously to that, she was a Senior PM at Karat.

While being a generalist and having a broad set of skills is in fact ideal for a Product Manager role, but as this function evolves, we are seeing more specialties each requiring a certain superpower. In order to be the most effective PM, first, it is important to choose a role that best fits your personality and to have a grasp of key trends and customer problems for your sector.

Goal/ Main takeaways from this session:

* Understand types of Product Managers and their superpower
* Overview of the top 3 successful sectors in tech
* Important product considerations in each sector

Growth is not a series of clever hacks, a silver bullet, or a killer feature. It is an iterative, data-driven process focused on building great products that add real value to users. In this workshop, Ken Rudin, ThoughtSpot SVP of User Growth, will be sharing the principles that led to such tremendous product growth at companies like Google, Facebook, and ThoughtSpot.

In this workshop, you will learn strategies to leverage PLG to:

* Lower customer acquisition costs
* Accelerates the sales cycle
* Improve customer experience
* Drive stronger long-term growth

**Meet the speaker: Ken Rudin**

Ken Rudin is an experienced entrepreneur and executive currently bringing his leadership skills to the ThoughtSpot team as their SVP of User Growth. He also has years of experience at top companies including Google, Facebook, and Salesforce.

What do companies want to hear in a Product Manager interview?

Aside from intellect, smarts, the power to adapt, think, and act on their feet? Companies want a person who is motivated to do the job, can work with different teams, and has the ability to prioritize. A Product Manager has to be resilient, strategic, and insightful. This means that the hiring company will ask a multitude of questions to figure out if you are the one.

Main takeaways:

* Cracking the Amazon job description
* What is a PM-T and PM?
* Interview tips and tricks

What does it take to be hired as a Product Manager? How can you leverage your current skills to make the transition? There are a few things you need to learn about before you make the switch. Whether you come from marketing, UX/UI, engineering, or even business, you need to know a few things first.

Main Takeaways:

* An easy to structure framework
* Leveraging technology to create brilliant product ideas
* Common pitfalls and mistakes to avoid.

Being a Product Manager requires structured and organized thinking. Frameworks and toolkits are a handy and effective way to approach problems. Product Managers learn about many and develop their own throughout their product careers and share some of those with you today.

Main Takeaways:

* Some details matter more than others: for requirements, for solutioning, for communicating with stakeholders
* Details that unlock major improvements to important use cases are the most important to explore in greater depth
* It’s important to zoom in and then zoom out repeatedly throughout the process of designing and building products

Andy Downard is a PayPal Product Leader working on Reverse Logistics. He joined PayPal after they acquired his previous company, Happy Returns, where he worked as a Senior PM for over three years.

No one becomes a good Product Manager in a day, but we help you look inside the minds of great PMs to understand the mindset that makes them succeed. Because Product Management isn’t just a role, it’s a worldview, a set of skills that guide the way you think, and most importantly lead.

Meet the Speaker: Tim Swaid

Tim is a Product Leader, currently working at Meta, with over a decade of experience building incredible interfaces. He believes that designing means caring, communication matters, and improvement comes from observation.

producttalkssingapore.content:
Product Talks Singapore

Adam Greco and John Cutler will be joining us for the next session of Product Talks across the APAC Region. Facilitated by Leading the Product, Adam and John will be having a fireside chat on 'Why Product & Marketing Need to Collaborate to Create Digital Experiences’ on Wednesday 30 March, 2022, at 11am AEST.

Customers expect to have a seamless experience and transition within digital products - regardless of the platform they use. But as traditional structures create barriers to digital optimization, it's imperative to increase collaboration across marketing and product teams when building cohesive product experiences. So how can your team do this?
Catch up on our online webinar to discover how to bring teams together when building digital experiences, ensuring an efficient, streamlined product experience for the customer.

You will leave this session with the main key takeaways:

* Why product and marketing need to collaborate
* Why having multiple analytics platforms can cause poor experiences
* Action plans for product & marketing teams to begin improving digital experiences together today
* Examples of creating synergies between marketing and product to foster efficient, user-friendly experiences

Please Register following this link to attend:

https://us02web.zoom....

This is a live online event so join us from wherever you are!

=======
About our Speakers:

Adam Greco, Product Evangelist, Amplitude
Adam Greco is one of the leaders of the digital marketing analytics industry. He has helped thousands of organizations improve their digital properties through the use of data, authoring the preeminent book on Adobe Analytics.

John Cutler, Product Coach & Amplitude Evangelist
John is keenly focused on user experience and evidence-driven product development. He mixes and matches various methodologies to help teams deliver lasting outcomes for their customers.

John currently works as Product Evangelist at Amplitude where he coaches hundreds of current and future customers on being more impact focused. As a former UX researcher at AppFolio, a product manager at Zendesk, (https://endo.io/...), AdKeeper and RichFX, a startup founder, and a product team coach, John has a perspective that spans individual roles, domains, and products.
(https://www.linkedin...." class="linkified">https://www.linkedin....)

=======
About our Event Sponsor:

(https://mplitude.com/...) is the Digital Optimization System. Powered by the proprietary Amplitude Behavioural Graph, the Digital Optimization System enables organizations to see and predict which combination of features and actions translate to business outcomes — from loyalty to lifetime value — and intelligently adapt each experience in real time based on these insights.

Amplitude is the brain behind more than 45,000 digital products at over 1,000 enterprise customers, including 23 of the Fortune 100, helping them innovate faster and smarter by answering the strategic question: “How do our digital products drive our business?”

Website: (https://amplitude.com..." class="linkified">https://amplitude.com...)
LinkedIn: (https://www.linkedin...." class="linkified">https://www.linkedin....) Twitter: (https://twitter.com/A..." class="linkified">https://twitter.com/A...)

Singapore, - Singapore

Wednesday, March 30 at 8:00 AM

1

Serverless Singapore.content:
Serverless Singapore

In our second talk of the year coming up on Thu, 17 March, we will be joined by Mark Teehan from Confluent.

Mark will talk about the lessons learned by the Confluent Cloud engineering team from making Apache Kafka serverless as well as deployment decisions to run mission critical Confluent Cloud clusters on any of the major cloud providers in Singapore (or elsewhere).

Here are the details:

Title: Cloud Native Apache Kafka®

Speaker Bio: Mark Teehan is a systems engineer at Confluent in Singapore. In his day-to-day work, Mark engages with organisations that are interested in event streaming, real-time ETL, or anything related to running Apache Kafka systems. Interest in Apache Kafka spans banks, telcos, airlines, digital natives, government departments, insurance, and manufacturing.

Date: Thursday, 17 March 2022

Time: 7 pm onward SGT

Format: This will be an online event on Zoom. To ensure safe usage, link required for joining the event will be visible only to the folks who register interest to attend the event.

As always, the floor is open for each one of you to share your valuable experiences on serverless with the community. Please feel free to drop me a line if you are interested in giving a talk at this or a future meetup. It'll be great to hear from you on what all you are learning and building with serverless.

See you then!

Singapore, - Singapore

Thursday, March 17 at 7:00 PM

27

https://www.meetup.com/Serverless-Singapore/events/284319391/

Singapore AI Developers Group.content:
Singapore AI/ML/Data Developers Group

== Register to receive join link here ==
https://www.aicamp.ai...

We are partnering with AWS team to host a series of AI/ML tech seminars for the community. We will give away a few AWS credits ($20/each) during the event.

Description:
Cheating in online gaming is on the rise and cheaters are getting increasingly sophisticated at evading human and rule-based detection with their cheats. Machine Learning is seen as the solution which can identify suspicious patterns and adapt to changes in cheater behavior, however a solution like this is often complex to implement and manage, with dedicated data science teams required to operate it effectively.

In this session, learn how services like Amazon Fraud Detector and Amazon SageMaker can be easily implemented to detect cheaters in online mobile games without any prior AI or ML knowledge required!

* Intended audience: IT engineers/sysadmins/developers interested in learning about AI/ML .
* Level: Intermediate

More events up coming (free join from anywhere):

Production RL Summit is a free 1-day virtual event that brings together ML engineers, data scientists, and researchers pioneering the use of reinforcement learning (RL) to solve real-world business problems.

Experts from JP Morgan, Riot Games, Dow, and Siemens will share their experience taking RL projects from idea to production. Hear about the biggest technical and business challenges they faced, how they tackled them, what they learned, and the future of RL at their organizations.

And more than listen, do! At the free RL Summit you’ll have the opportunity to:
\- Learn practical tips and best practices for bringing RL into your AI portfolio\.
\- Connect and share with your peers and experts in the RL community\.
\- Build your RL skills with a hands\-on practical introduction to RL led by Sven Mika\, lead developer on the popular open source RL library\, RLlib\.

Who should attend?
\- ML engineers\, researchers\, and data scientists interested in bringing RL into their AI strategy\.
\- RL practitioners who want to connect with and learn from their industry experts and peers\.
\- Students and academics interested in learning about applied RL use cases\.

More events up coming (free join from anywhere):

Singapore Artificial Intelligence.content:
Singapore Artificial Intelligence

Kindly register for the free webinar here - https://bit.ly/3MzMX4...

With the rise of AI and machine learning (ML) in business. The conventional method is changing to become more technology-driven. It has become more important than ever to understand the building blocks of AI and set the strategic technical direction for the entire team and the organization.

There is a general perception is that a lot of mathematics is required to learn AI. However, we believe that anybody can learn AI and apply that knowledge at work or, even in our day-to-day life.

With this background, the webinar aims to offer a macro understanding of AI & ML, and their applications in the field of management and business.

In this webinar, the agenda for this webinar is:
1\. Introduction to AI for Managers
2\. Why AI and ML in the field of Management
3\. Examples and Use Cases
4\. Why choose this course?
5\. Application Process for the Course
6\. Q & A

Singapore Elastic Fantastics.content:
Elastic Singapore User Group

THIS IS A FREE EVENT - PLEASE FINISH YOUR RSVP IN THE LINK BELOW

https://community.ela...

Hi, Elastic Fantastics!

In our connected world, it is now even more critical to take action on your data in real-time. However, access to quality data is a common challenge and requires custom code is to consume from different data structures and sources. Learn how Confluent’s pre-built connectors and stream processing solve these issues, by helping organizations take action in real-time with a highly scalable streaming integration platform, and by connecting your common SIEM platforms such as Splunk, Elasticsearch, and many more.

In this session, we’ll look at how stream-processing can be used to perform real-time anomaly detection in streaming event data, filter, and aggregate nosing data, and how to route data from Splunk to Elasticsearch while keeping all its valuable metadata.

Agenda

---

Speaker

Johnny Mirza - Confluent (Senior Solutions Engineer)

Johnny has a strong technical background supporting the Telco, Media, Insurance, and Transport industry verticals. Elastic Singapore User Group
 
THIS IS A FREE EVENT - PLEASE FINISH YOUR RSVP IN THE LINK BELOW
 https://community.ela...
 Hi, Elastic Fantastics!
 In our connected world, it is now even more critical to take action on your data in real-time. However, access to quality data is a common challenge and requires custom code is to consume from different data structures and sources. Learn how Confluent’s pre-built connectors and stream processing solve these issues, by helping organizations take action in real-time with a highly scalable streaming integration platform, and by connecting your common SIEM platforms such as Splunk, Elasticsearch, and many more.
 In this session, we’ll look at how stream-processing can be used to perform real-time anomaly detection in streaming event data, filter, and aggregate nosing data, and how to route data from Splunk to Elasticsearch while keeping all its valuable metadata.

Singapore iOS Dev Scout Meetup.content:
Singapore iOS Dev Scout Meetup

iOS Dev Scout 2022 March edition!

Join us on the 23rd March for an evening of #iOS and #Swift talks, show & tell, and Kahoot!
We have 2 awesome speakers who prepared awesome talks for you to learn something new!


iOS Dev Scout Meetup Rooftop link will be revealed when you RSVP
Sponsored by Gather.town


Priyal Porwal, Senior Software Engineer at PayTM, India
Rudrank Riyam, DevRel Engineer @codemagicio
Twitter: @rudrankriyam


Topic:
**Enhance user experience with Accessibility and Localization Support in Swift UI by Priyal Porwal**

Description:
We can make our application more accessible and reach a global audience by adding support of Accessibility and Localization in our SwiftUI Application with very little work from the developer’s end

In this talk, I’ll cover adding custom accessibility and localization support to your Application, using Xcode 13 latest enhancements for getting a quick idea about your app behaviour during development.


Topic:
**Speeding up Local iOS Builds with Remote Caching by Rudrank Riyam**

Description:
Do you wish your local builds were significantly faster?

In this talk, I go through the concept of remote caching using the open-source tool XCRemoteCache by Spotify. It is a remote cache tool for your Xcode projects that reuses target artifacts. They are generated on a remote machine, preferably on your CI service, uploading to a WebDAV capable REST server. Then, your local machine can access it. This concept can also be applied to different tools.
Normally, developers compile the project on their machine every time they build it. A remote cache helps you speed up builds by compiling once, and then everyone can use that cache. It is particularly useful for big projects with multiple targets or dependencies that don’t often require updates.

Saving developers’ productive time is crucial, and using XCRemoteCache or a remote caching tool helps them reduce build times by caching targets and dependencies remotely.


• 7:00-7:10pm: Welcome! Say hi to other devs, you're free to explore the Rooftop!
• 7:15pm: Enhance user experience with Accessibility and Localization Support in Swift UI by Priyal Porwal
• 7:45pm: Speeding up Local iOS Builds with Remote Caching by Rudrank Riyam
• 8:05pm: Show & Tell

We're looking for speakers for April 2022 meetup! Ping @iosdevscout or @vinamelody if you're interested :)


CFP for iOS Conf SG 2023 is now open!
Submit your proposal now or wait until WWDC https://www.papercall...

iOS Conf SG has been awarded the ‘Most Commended’ iOS event worldwide by the Swift Community Awards, which celebrates the amazing iOS community worldwide and recognises the hard work of developers, individuals and projects that help make Swift great.

Follow us on Twitter at @iOSDevScout and @iOSConfSG for all the latest updates!

https://www.youtube.c...

Singapore Kafka Meetup.content:
Singapore Apache Kafka® Meetup by Confluent

Hello Streamers!

Our friends from Serverless Singapore will be hosting this fun and informative meetup!

**RSVP and check the link below for more information:**
https://www.meetup.co...

Find information about upcoming meetups and tons of content from past Apache Kafka® Meetups all over the world:
(https://cnfl.io/meetup...)

\-\-\-\-\-
Speaker:
Mark Teehan, Principal Solutions Engineer, Confluent

Bio:
Mark Teehan is a systems engineer at Confluent in Singapore. In his day-to-day work, Mark engages with organisations that are interested in event streaming, real-time ETL, or anything related to running Apache Kafka systems. Interest in Apache Kafka spans banks, telcos, airlines, digital natives, government departments, insurance, and manufacturing.

Talk:
Cloud Native Apache Kafka®

Abstract:
Mark will talk about the lessons learned by the Confluent Cloud engineering team from making Apache Kafka serverless as well as deployment decisions to run mission critical Confluent Cloud clusters on any of the major cloud providers in Singapore (or elsewhere).

\-\-\-\-
If you would like to speak or host our next event please let us know! community@(https://confluent.io/...)

Singapore Kubernetes User Group.content:
Singapore Kubernetes User Group

**Prevent Kubernetes misconfigurations with Datree open-source CLI**

* While developing Datree, we reviewed 100+ postmortems to discover the recurring patterns, anti-patterns, and root causes of typical outages in Kubernetes-based systems.
* With the insights that we’ve gathered, we launched our open source Datree.
* However. the more we deepened our research we learned that governing policies is only the beginning of achieving reliability, security, and stability for your Kubernetes cluster.
* Surprisingly, we found out that the ultimate solution might be also a key solution for resolving the DevOps vs Development deadlock once and for all.
* In this session, we'll review some of the top Kubernetes failure stories that we've read and demonstrate how YOU can use the Datree open source project to make sure these mistakes will not happen to you.

**Shimon Tolts**, AWS Community Hero, CEO & Co-Founder at Datree:

* Shimon established and managed the Software Engineering Infrastructure department for 400 engineers at ironSource.
* Also as an AWS Community Hero, Shimon runs the largest AWS user group worldwide and is an avid speaker at conferences.
* Today, Shimon is the CEO & Co-Founder at Datree, an automated policy enforcement solution for Kubernetes.
* It helps to prevent misconfigurations from code through production. Datree allows seamless management and enforcement policies across Developers and DevOps engineers.

**Noaa Barki**, Developer Advocate at Datree:

* Noaa is a senior full-stack developer, community manager, and developer advocate who wishes to encourage developers to deepen the decisions we make during the development processes, research the technologies we use, and share our knowledge.
* She started her journey in the 8200 Unit of the IDF Intelligence forces where Noaa took her first steps in software development.
* In the last 5 years, her work has mainly included full-stack development technologies such as Golang, Node.js, React as well as DevOps technologies and infrastructure such as Kubernetes and Helm

**Zoom Details**:

* https://us02web.zoom....
* Passcode: 648081

Singapore, - Singapore

Thursday, March 17 at 8:00 PM

Singapore LeetCode.content:
LeetCode Club SG

Join the weekly LeetCode Contest with us, and share your thoughts or ask any data structure & algorithm questions!

- Link to weekly contest: https://leetcode.com/...
- Singapore LeetCode club Telegram channel: https://t.me/joinchat...

- Join the contest and finish the problems, as much and as quickly as you can!
- Come on-site and sit with us, or do the contest at your place
- Ask questions, what's the complexity? Met a TLE? How to solve it???
- Share your answers with explanation, more sharing means more improvement :)
- Sit with other coders together (if we have a venue set up), or discuss in our Telegram channel.

Happy coding!

Singapore Ruby Group.content:
Singapore Ruby Group

🌵 Yoz! 👋 It’s March 2022 and we are planning for another RubySG meetup!

This month, I will be sharing about my experience trying out Shrine.rb while building file uploads in my Ruby on Rails app. I've heard folks talking about how file uploads is difficult and sure enough, I've learnt a lot rummaging though many new things in the world of file uploads. While I have not figured it all out, I think I've figured out enough to get anyone new started. As for the fancy file upload UX, I'll leave that for next time when I have it figured out. 😅

➡️ Find all details in the GitHub issue below.

Singapore Startup Founder 101.content:
Singapore Startup Founder 101

Do you have a startup, or a strong idea for a startup? Could you use blunt, honest feedback on your startup ideas? On this live and interactive online event you can pitch your ideas to a panel of Space Tech startup investors and experts for ratings and feedback, all from the comfort of your home. Even if you don't want to pitch, you are invited to hear startup ideas and watch how the experts analyze businesses.

**\>\> This is an interactive\, live online event\. To access the event\, RSVP at (https://fi.co/e/27467..." class="linkified">https://fi.co/e/27467...)**

***\>\> To pre\-submit your pitch\, visit https://forms\.gle/sp...***

Who should Attend?

* **Anyone who wants feedback from leading entrepreneurs**
* Anyone who has an early-stage startup and wants expert feedback
* Anyone who has an idea for a startup or a tech company
* Anyone who needs practice and expert advice on pitching

\>\> Who Pitches?
We will be selecting people from the audience to pitch, and will do as many as time allows. To prepare, work on your one sentence pitch at (https://fi.co/madlibs..." class="linkified">https://fi.co/madlibs]...), and pre-submit your pitch at *https://forms.gle/spK...*

\>\> Spectators are welcome\!
Even if you don't want to pitch, you are invited to register, hear startup ideas, and watch how the experts analyze and critique new businesses.

**\>\> This is an interactive\, live online event\. To access the event\, RSVP at (https://fi.co/e/27467..." class="linkified">https://fi.co/e/27467...)**

Singapore, - Singapore

Thursday, March 17 at 9:00 AM

singapore yugabytedb user group.content:
Singapore YugabyteDB User Group

You can provision a cloud native GraphQL API layer and start serving applications within minutes. However, readying this layer for production workloads has its challenges. For starters, what if the number of requests grows 2x, 10x, or 100x? Or, what if the data volume goes from 10GB to 100GB and then 1TB? And what if a cloud availability zone that hosts the API layer experiences outages?

Join this hands-on session on 16 March 2022 at 9am PT on LinkedIn Live, where Denis Magda, Director, Developer Relations at Yugabyte and Praveen Durairaju, Senior Developer Advocate at Hasura, will build a cloud native GraphQL API layer. You’ll learn how this API scales horizontally to serve ever-growing data volumes with user requests while tolerating various cloud outages.

You’ll also explore:
-How to provision a scalable GraphQL layer with Hasura Cloud.
-How to deploy a distributed and resilient data layer with Yugabyte Cloud.
-How to assemble a final solution by interconnecting Hasura and Yugabyte Cloud.

You can attend and register for the event here: https://www.linkedin....

Singapore, - Singapore

Thursday, March 17 at 12:00 AM

3

https://www.meetup.com/singapore-yugabytedb-user-group/events/284259931/

singapore yugabytedb user group.content:
Singapore YugabyteDB User Group

On 16 Mar 2022 at 8pm PT, we are hosting the virtual training "YugabyteDB YSQL Development Intermediate".

Modern transactional applications require a distributed SQL database that supports almost 50 years of SQL advancements. In this virtual training, you will learn more about the Data Definition Language (DDL) features of Yugabyte SQL (YSQL), which is highly compatible with PostgreSQL.

These YSQL language features include column constraints, indexes, views, expressions, operators, built-in functions, user-defined functions, and triggers. Additionally, this course will cover compatible extensions for YSQL.

You can attend and register for the event here: https://university.yu...

Singapore, - Singapore

Thursday, March 17 at 11:00 AM

Singapore YugabyteDB User Group

The next YugabyteDB Friday Tech Talk (YFTT) takes place on LinkedIn Live, Friday 18th Mar at 9:30am PT.

In part one of this special two-part YFTT presentation, join Yugabyte Distinguished Engineer Alan Caldera and co-founder Kannan Muthukkaruppan, as they give an overview of Backup/Restore operations in YugabyteDB.

The second part of this presentation will be presented by Yugabyte expert Sergei Politov in two weeks (April 1st) and will cover PITR (Point-in-Time Restore) operations.

Singapore YugabyteDB User Group

On 23rd March 2022 at 11:30AM SGT, join our webinar "Yugabyte Cloud Basics: Explore Effortless Distributed SQL at Limitless Scale".

This session, presented by Yugabyte expert Balachandar Seetharaman, will dive into the basics of Yugabyte Cloud.

We'll walk through best practices for cluster deployment, security, connectivity, monitoring, and performance. We'll also demo the available scale-out options through a sample data loading example.

You can attend and register for the event here: https://yugabyte.zoom...

singapore yugabytedb user group.content:
Singapore YugabyteDB User Group

On 23 Mar 2022 at 8pm PT, we are hosting the virtual training "YugabyteDB YSQL Development Advanced".

Cloud-native applications with transactional workloads often require low latency and high availability. In this virtual training, you will learn about some of the advanced YSQL language features that help minimize the negative effects of high-latency communications and network outages.

These YSQL language features include table partitioning, tablespaces, and row-level geo-partioning. In addition, this training will cover the JDBC Smart Driver, tablet splitting, and the basics of performance tuning.

You can attend and register for the event here: (https://university.yu..." class="linkified">https://university.yu...)

Startup Agile Group Singapore.content:
Startup Agile Group - Singapore

The Startup success rate still is very low compared to the failure rate.

This interactive session will give insights into the top Startup failure factors and how Design Thinking will help to handle and overcome those failure factors to succeed in your Startup.

**Event Fee:** FREE

**Language:** English

**What you need to attend the session:**

* Device to connect (i.e. PC, Laptop, Tablet).
* Good Internet connection.
* Webcam.
* Download and install Zoom on your device.

**Agenda:**
17:30 -17:35 GMT+8:00 - Welcome Note
17:35 -18:20 GMT+8:00 - **Design Thinking for Startup Success** by AB Reddy, Founder of Startup Agile, Human Centric Thinker
18:20 - 18:30 GMT+8:00 - Q&A

**This session is for you if:**

* You are a startup enthusiast
* You are a startup founder
* You are a startup team member

*This session has limited seats. Please RSVP only if you are serious to join the session, so that there are seats available for those who really need this session.*

Singapore, - Singapore

Saturday, March 19 at 5:30 PM

Startup Agile Group Singapore.content:
Startup Agile Group - Singapore

Meet and Team-up with people who are looking to build a Startup success team or who are keen to join one.

Great opportunity to connect Startups with talent. Let's meet and team up for success.

**Event Fee:** Free
**Language:** English

**What you need to attend the session:**

* Device to connect (i.e. PC, Laptop, Tablet).
* Good Internet connection.
* Webcam.
* Download and install Zoom on your device.

**Agenda:**
07:00 PM – 07:15 PM: Keynote on Startup Teaming by A B Reddy (Startup Agile Founder)

07:15 PM – 08:45 PM: Startup Team Pitch\* (5 minutes for each Startup/Idea)

08:45 PM – 09:00 PM: Wrap up

***\*For Startup Team Pitch:***
Please register (https://forms.gle/XRg..." class="linkified">https://forms.gle/XRg...)
(to pitch your idea/startup to the Team).

**Who can attend?**

* If you have an idea for Startup
* If you want to join a Startup
* If you are looking for a technical or business cofounder for your Startup
* Lean Startup founders
* Seed Funders, Angel Funders, and Crowd Funders
* Capital Investors
* Inventors, Innovators
* Design Thinking facilitators
* Business Strategy Leaders
* Startup Mentors
* Programmers, Architects, UI, UX, DB, Analysts, Developers
* Domain specialists in:
* Big Data
* Artificial Intelligence (AI)
* Robotics
* Internet of Things (IoT)
* Blockchain
* Augmented Reality (AR)
* Cyber Security
* Growth hackers
* Job Seekers
* University Fresh Graduates

**Why should you attend?**

* To team up for Startup success.
* To understand Startup insight
* To find the right team members and build connections
* To network

Startup Prodigy Singapore.content:
Startup Prodigy Singapore

Startup Open Space - Online Workshop

In this event, attendees will be able to suggest the Startup topics that they are most passionate about. Then run self-organized, interactive, and collaborative sessions with your fellow attendees to learn about and explore the topic further.

There will be multiple sessions going on at the same time, giving you the opportunity to exercise the Law of 2 feet to move on to something else.

What is Open Space?
Open Space or the Open Space Technology format is a participant-driven process whose agenda is created by people attending.
(https://en.wikipedia....)

What you need to attend the session:

* Device to connect (i.e. PC, Laptop, Tablet).
* Good Internet connection.
* Webcam.
* Download and install Zoom on your device.

Event Fee: FREE

Language: English

Tech Startup Entrepreneurs Venture Capital MasterMinds Group

**Startup Entrepreneurs – Free LIVE Fundraising Q&A with Angel Investor/Serial Founder/Startup Expert Scott Fox**

Bring your startup questions to the Startup Council’s FREE founder fundraising “Office Hours”. You'll get FREE expert Silicon Valley advice to help diverse entrepreneurs start, raise money, and grow new ventures.

Have questions about raising venture capital? How to find product/market fit? Angel investors? Pitch decks? Building your team? Protecting your intellectual property? How to find investors and pitch to raise your seed round? Starting a company as a first-time, female, or minority founder?

A fun, friendly #livestream videocast show for startup founders and friends, our mission is to increase access to innovation and investment for all. Join startup expert, Scott Fox, for valuable startup strategy advice, fundraising expertise, and networking, too.

**WHEN**: The 4th Tuesday of every month at NOON Pacific Time (300pm ET/\~800pm UK): (https://mastermindsof..." class="linkified">https://mastermindsof...)

(https://www.facebook...." class="linkified">https://www.facebook....)
(https://mastermindsof..." class="linkified">https://mastermindsof...)
Podcast: (https://scottfoxradio...." class="linkified">https://scottfoxradio....)

**RSVP to SUBMIT YOUR QUESTION > WIN FREE WORKSHOP TICKETS:**
Submit your Startup Question or your startup's Investor Pitch IN ADVANCE for friendly, free expert feedback LIVE: (https://www.mastermin..." class="linkified">https://www.mastermin...)

*If Scott picks your question or investor pitch for discussion during the show, you'll get special instructions on how to join him live on camera and WIN FREE TICKETS to the next MasterMinds Startup Accelerator Workshop! ((https://www.mastermind..." class="linkified">https://www.mastermind...)*

Your Host & Moderator: Scott Fox CEO of the Startup Council, Chairman of Stanford Angels & Entrepreneurs Orange County, Tech Coast Angels, investor in 20+ startup companies, serial startup founder, best-selling entrepreneurship author of Click Millionaires, Internet Riches, more…

**RSVP: Send in your Startup Question here now BEFORE the show: (https://www.mastermin..." class="linkified">https://www.mastermin...)**

(https://us02web.zoom...." class="linkified">https://us02web.zoom....)

Once registered, you will receive a link and dial in information to teleconference by email, that you can also add to your calendar.

8:00 AM - 9:00 AM Pacific Daylight Time (PDT)
Matthias Hertel, Product Specialist, Arm
"Accelerate ML development with cloud-based Arm Cortex-M models"

Arm Virtual Hardware provides accurate models of Cortex-M based processors for application developers to build and test software without hardware. Arm Virtual Hardware seamlessly integrates into desktop IDE-based development as well as into cloud-hosted CI/CD and MLOps workflows. All models provide the Virtual Streaming Interface (VSI), a Python-scriptable peripheral. VSI can feed in real-world or synthetic data into the ML application, allowing complex, large-scale test and validation of inference engine integration and model design.

Learn how the TensorFlow OSS project leverages Arm Virtual Hardware to improve Arm Cortex-M based target optimizations.

Matthias Hertel is Product Specialist for microcontroller tools at Arm. He brings nearly two decades of experience with software development solutions for Arm-based microcontrollers, most currently exploring how to make ML and IoT workflows more efficient with cloud-native methodologies.

We encourage you to register earlier since on-line broadcast capacity may be limited.

He is currently a Product & Sales Manager working along with an AI unicorn company based in Shenzhen (UBTECH Robotics). In his free time, he enjoys designing electronics hardware kits and hosting Arduino and Raspberry Pi-related classes. He regularly attends Maker Faire events held throughout the world and is active in the developer community. His tagline is "GET INSPIRED, MAKE THINGS HAPPEN!"

Soham and Archana are ML Engineers. He works in the field of automation, NLP and edge computing. He has co-created a nanodegree with Intel and Udacity: Intel AI on Edge Nanodegree.
